Name: Samosa
Description: Triangular pastry filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat, fried until crispy.

Name: Chicken Tikka Masala
Description: Grilled chicken pieces cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce with Indian spices.

Name: Paneer Tikka
Description: Cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) marinated in spices and grilled to perfection.

Name: Biryani
Description: Fragrant rice dish cooked with marinated meat (chicken, lamb, or goat), spices, and herbs.

Name: Butter Chicken
Description: Chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based sauce, flavored with butter and mild spices.

Name: Chole Bhature
Description: Spicy chickpea curry served with deep-fried bread called bhatura.

Name: Palak Paneer
Description: Cubes of paneer cooked in a creamy spinach sauce flavored with Indian spices.

Name: Aloo Paratha
Description: Indian flatbread stuffed with spiced mashed potatoes, cooked on a griddle with ghee.

Name: Rogan Josh
Description: Aromatic lamb curry cooked with yogurt, tomatoes, and a blend of spices.

Name: Tandoori Chicken
Description: Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, cooked in a tandoor (clay oven) for a smoky flavor.

Name: Dal Makhani
Description: Creamy lentil curry cooked with butter, cream, and aromatic spices.

Name: Pani Puri
Description: Crisp hollow puris filled with spicy, tangy water, chickpeas, potatoes, and tamarind chutney.

Name: Rasgulla
Description: Spongy balls made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) soaked in sugar syrup.

Name: Gulab Jamun
Description: Deep-fried milk-solid dumplings soaked in sugar syrup, flavored with cardamom.

Name: Chicken Curry
Description: Chicken pieces cooked in a flavorful gravy made with onions, tomatoes, and spices.

Name: Vegetable Pakora
Description: Assorted vegetables coated in chickpea flour batter and deep-fried until crispy.

Name: Aloo Tikki
Description: Spiced mashed potato patties, shallow-fried until golden brown and crispy.

Name: Malai Kofta
Description: Deep-fried vegetable dumplings served in a creamy gravy made with cashew nuts and cream.

Name: Fish Curry
Description: Fish pieces cooked in a spicy and tangy curry sauce made with coconut milk and Indian spices.

Name: Chicken 65
Description: Deep-fried spicy chicken bites, often served as an appetizer or snack.

Name: Dosa
Description: Thin, crispy pancake made from fermented rice and lentil batter, served with chutney and sambar.

Name: Idli
Description: Soft, spongy rice cakes made from fermented rice and lentil batter, served with chutney and sambar.

Name: Sambar
Description: Tangy and spicy lentil-based vegetable stew, often served with dosa, idli, or rice.

Name: Masala Dosa
Description: Dosa filled with a spiced potato filling and served with chutney and sambar.

Name: Vada Pav
Description: Spicy potato fritter served in a bun with various chutneys, popular street food in Mumbai.

Name: Pav Bhaji
Description: Mashed mixed vegetable curry served with buttered bread rolls, a popular street food.

Name: Chicken Korma
Description: Chicken cooked in a mild and creamy gravy flavored with nuts, yogurt, and aromatic spices.

Name: Prawn Curry
Description: Prawns cooked in a spicy and tangy coconut-based curry sauce with Indian spices.

Name: Chicken Biryani
Description: Fragrant rice dish cooked with marinated chicken pieces, spices, and herbs.

Name: Egg Curry
Description: Hard-boiled eggs cooked in a flavorful gravy made with onions, tomatoes, and spices.

Name: Chicken Lollipop
Description: Chicken wings frenched to resemble lollipops, marinated, and deep-fried.

Name: Tandoori Fish
Description: Fish marinated in yogurt and spices, cooked in a tandoor for a smoky flavor.

Name: Vegetable Biryani
Description: Fragrant rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables, spices, and herbs.

Name: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani
Description: Aromatic rice dish layered with marinated meat and cooked on a slow flame for a rich flavor.

Name: Chicken Malai Seekh Kebab
Description: Minced chicken mixed with spices and cream, skewered and grilled until tender.

Name: Mutton Korma
Description: Tender mutton cooked in a mild and creamy gravy flavored with nuts, yogurt, and aromatic spices.

Name: Papdi Chaat
Description: Crisp fried dough wafers topped with boiled potatoes, chickpeas, yogurt, and tangy chutneys.

Name: Dahi Vada
Description: Lentil dumplings soaked in yogurt and topped with tangy tamarind chutney and spices.

Name: Vegetable Cutlet
Description: Mashed vegetable patties seasoned with spices, coated in breadcrumbs, and shallow-fried until golden brown.

Name: Aloo Samosa
Description: Deep-fried pastry filled with spiced potato mixture, often served with mint or tamarind chutney.

Name: Mysore Pak
Description: Rich and buttery sweet made from chickpea flour, ghee, and sugar, originating from the city of Mysore in Karnataka.

Name: Gajar ka Halwa
Description: Rich and decadent Indian dessert made from grated carrots, milk, sugar, and ghee, flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts.

Name: Thandai
Description: Traditional Indian cold drink made with milk, almonds, cashews, saffron, and flavored with spices like cardamom and fennel, often consumed during festivals like Holi.

Name: Misal Pav
Description: Spicy curry made from sprouted moth beans (matki), topped with crispy sev, chopped onions, cilantro, and served with pav (bread rolls), popular in Maharashtra.

Name: Tamarind Date Chutney
Description: Sweet and tangy chutney made from tamarind pulp, dates, jaggery, and spices like cumin and ginger, commonly used in chaats and snacks.

Name: Upma
Description: South Indian breakfast dish made from semolina (sooji) cooked with vegetables, mustard seeds, curry leaves, and spices.

Name: Vada
Description: Savory deep-fried fritters made from urad dal (black gram) batter, often served with coconut chutney or sambar.
